shortdesc.ph: Sets subscription options for the remote video stream.
Sets the subscription options for remote video streams.
Sets the subscription options for the remote video stream.
Sets the subscription options for the remote video stream.

p.codeblock: Future<void> setRemoteVideoSubscriptionOptions( {required int uid, required VideoSubscriptionOptions options});
public abstract int SetRemoteVideoSubscriptionOptions(uint uid, VideoSubscriptionOptions options);

section.p:
When the remote side sends dual streams, you can call this method to set subscription options for the remote video stream. The SDK's default subscription behavior for remote video streams depends on the type of registered video observer:
If is registered, the SDK subscribes to both raw and encoded data by default.
If is registered, the SDK subscribes only to encoded data by default.
If both observers are registered, the SDK follows the one registered later. For example, if is registered later, the SDK subscribes to both raw and encoded data by default. If you want to change the default behavior above, or set different subscription options for different uids, you can call this method to configure.

When the remote user sends dual streams, you can call this method to set the subscription options for the remote video stream. The SDK's default subscription behavior for remote video streams depends on the type of registered video observer:
If is registered, both raw and encoded data are subscribed by default.
If is registered, only encoded data is subscribed by default.
If both observers are registered, the default behavior follows the later registered observer. For example, if is registered later, both raw and encoded data are subscribed by default. If you want to change the default behavior above or set different subscription options for different uids, you can call this method.

When the remote side sends dual streams, you can call this method to set the subscription options for the remote video stream. The SDK's default subscription behavior for remote video streams depends on the type of registered video observer:
If is registered, the SDK subscribes to both raw and encoded data by default.
If is registered, the SDK subscribes to encoded data only by default.
If both observers are registered, the SDK follows the most recently registered one. For example, if is registered later, the SDK subscribes to both raw and encoded data by default. If you want to change the above default behavior or set different subscription options for different uids, you can call this method.

When the remote user sends dual streams, you can call this method to set the subscription options for the remote video stream. The SDK's default subscription behavior for remote video streams depends on the type of video observer registered:
If is registered, both raw and encoded data are subscribed to by default.
If is registered, only encoded data is subscribed to by default.
If both observers are registered, the default follows the one registered later. For example, if is registered later, both raw and encoded data are subscribed to by default. If you want to change the default behavior above or set different subscription options for different uids, you can call this method.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
